It is not pseudo science Frank.

It is a well researched and documented thi=
ng.=C2=A0 
=C2=A0"Nature is showing us only the tail of the lion, but I hav=
e no doubt that the lion belongs to it even though, because of its large si=
ze, it cannot totally reveal itself all at once." 
-=E2=80=94 Albert Einste=
in 


"It is far better to grasp the universe as it really is than to persi=
st in delusions, however satisfying and reassuring."
--Carl Sagan


"There =
is no such thing as an insignificant detail. Don't just look 
for what you =
want to find."
-- Me LOL 




________________________________
From: Frank =
Sumption <purplealiengirl@...>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Fri,=
 April 23, 2010 4:47:55 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] nuff said?

=C2=A0 
=C2=
=A0It was implied that all this stuff is "Pareidolia", and because you coul=
d put a name on it that somehow meant it was all explanined. I've been hear=
ing this pseudo scientific BS for 10 years, so I'm a bit touchy. Science ex=
plains the paranormal away, and yet people continune to photograph images, =
and get their names, and the names of deseased loved ones through EVP, as w=
ell as questions answered, and science(althogh not all scientists)=C2=A0jus=
t ignores these inconvinient facts and focuses on=C2=A0that we=C2=A0might s=
ee things that are not there, which I disagree with as well. 

=C2=A0Did yo=
u even bother looking at the image on the group home page. That was from sw=
eeping a TV tuner with a random voltage and video recording the monitor scr=
een. So explain away why there is a wolf image embedded in the guy's hat, a=
n image of an alien below his ear, and why in God's name does he resembles =
the classic description=C2=A0of an MIB or=C2=A0Shadow Person?=C2=A0 Pareido=
lia no doubt!

=C2=A0F-S


On Fri, Apr 23, 2010 at 3:19 PM, Rj <rasterer@ya=
hoo. com> wrote:

=C2=A0 
>I'm not sure who you're talking to about "holier=
 than thou".=C2=A0 But, you are the one who keeps dismissing any question a=
bout results and testing with phrases like "Bite Me". I don't see anyone el=
se doing that, and I certainly never have.
>
>I agree trying new things is =
good.=C2=A0 And discussing results.=C2=A0 And looking for new directions.=
=C2=A0=C2=A0 So I'm still not sure who you are upset with.=C2=A0 Perhaps yo=
u could be more specific: quote what you have found objectionable, and let =
us know why?
>
>
>
>--- On Fri, 4/23/10, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@ g=
mail.com> wrote:
>
>
>>From: Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@ gmail.com>
>>=
Subject: [EVP-ITC] nuff said?
>>To: evp-itc@yahoogroups .com
>>Date: Friday=
, April 23, 2010, 12:59 PM 
>>
>>
>>
>>=C2=A0 
>>"Congratulations! bulletba=
bea has changed your membership status for the
>>group EVP-ITC from Member =
to Moderator." 
>>
>>=C2=A0Go ahead skepdorks, make my day!=C2=A0=C2=A0I do=
n't mind some honest debate, but not this holier than thou science BS, wher=
e you think cuz you stick a label on something=C2=A0it can be dismissed as =
thoroughly debunked. Maybe--I'm easily offended, and I'll take that into ac=
count. 
>>
>>=C2=A0F-S
